clinical_study.brief_title: Comparing an Investigational Medication Versus an Approved Medication in Reducing Cholesterol Levels (0653-025)
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Double-Blind, Randomized, Parallel Group, 28-Week Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Ezetimibe and Simvastatin Co-administration Versus Atorvastatin in Patients With Hypercholesteremia

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether an investigational medication will be more effective than an approved medication in reducing cholesterol levels.

primary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the effect on the reduction in low density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) after the initial 6-week treatment period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess safety/tolerability and evaluate effect on HDL-C & on reduction of LDL-C
Evaluate % of pts who attain their NCEP-ATP III goal for LDL-C @ each dose level

intervention.intervention_name: MK0653, ezetimibe / Duration of Treatment: 28 weeks
Comparator: atorvastatin / Duration of Treatment: 28 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Elevated cholesterol levels
Exclusion Criteria:
- Liver disease
- Unstable medical conditions
